meanings.definition: The practice of obtaining information or input into a task or project by enlisting the services of a large number of people, typically via the internet.
meanings.sent1: Crowdsourcing can help gather ideas from many individuals online.
meanings.sent2: The company used crowdsourcing to collect feedback from customers.
meanings.sent3: When the team couldn't decide on a logo, they turned to crowdsourcing for help.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to problem-solving was like crowdsourcing her brain for solutions.
meanings.sent5: The power of crowdsourcing lies in its ability to tap into collective knowledge.

meanings.definition: The act of outsourcing tasks to a large group of people or community, especially through an open call for contributions.
meanings.sent1: Crowdsourcing projects can involve people from different backgrounds working together.
meanings.sent2: The organization embraced crowdsourcing to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The town's decision to crowdsourcing the park's design led to a beautiful outcome.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was like crowdsourcing responsibilities among team members.
meanings.sent5: The success of the event was attributed to the effective crowdsourcing of resources.
